peripheralPage.name: _instance

binaryOption.name: smc_pmprot_ahsrun
binaryOption.toolTip: This write-once field allows the MCU to enter High Speed Run mode (HSRUN)

binaryOption.name: smc_pmprot_avlp
binaryOption.toolTip: This write-once bit allows the MCU to enter any very low power modes: VLPR, VLPW, and VLPS

choice.name: VLPR, VLPW and VLPS are not allowed
VLPR, VLPW and VLPS are allowed

binaryOption.name: smc_pmprot_alls
binaryOption.toolTip: This write once bit allows the MCU to enter any low leakage stop mode: LLS

binaryOption.name: smc_pmprot_avlls
binaryOption.description: Allow very low leakage stop mode
binaryOption.toolTip: This write once bit allows the MCU to enter any low leakage stop mode: VLLSx

peripheralPage.template: \t// Power Mode Protection Register \tstatic constexpr uint8_t pmprot = #ifdef SMC_PMPROT_AHSRUN \t SMC_PMPROT_AHSRUN($(smc_pmprot_ahsrun:0)) | // Allow High Speed Run mode #endif \t SMC_PMPROT_AVLP($(smc_pmprot_avlp:0)) | // Allow very low power modes \t SMC_PMPROT_ALLS($(smc_pmprot_alls:0)) | // Allow low leakage stop mode \t SMC_PMPROT_AVLLS($(smc_pmprot_avlls:0)); // Allow very low leakage stop mode\n\n

choiceOption.name: smc_stopctrl_pstopo
choiceOption.toolTip: These bits control whether a Partial Stop mode is entered when STOPM=STOP

choice.name: PSTOP1 - Partial Stop with both system and bus clocks disabled
PSTOP2 - Partial Stop with system clock disabled and bus clock enabled

binaryOption.name: smc_stopctrl_porpo
binaryOption.toolTip: This bit controls whether the POR detect circuit is enabled in VLLS0 mode

choice.name: POR detect circuit is enabled in VLLS0
POR detect circuit is disabled in VLLS0

binaryOption.name: smc_stopctrl_ram2po
binaryOption.toolTip: This bit controls powering of RAM partition 2 in VLLS2 mode

choiceOption.name: smc_stopctrl_llsm
choiceOption.toolTip: This field controls which LLS or VLLS sub-mode to enter if STOPM = LLSx or VLLSx

choice.name: VLLS0 if PMCTRL[STOPM]=VLLSx, reserved if PMCTRL[STOPM]=LLSx
VLLS1 if PMCTRL[STOPM]=VLLSx, reserved if PMCTRL[STOPM]=LLSx
VLLS2 if PMCTRL[STOPM]=VLLSx, LLS2 if PMCTRL[STOPM]=LLSx
VLLS3 if PMCTRL[STOPM]=VLLSx, LLS3 if PMCTRL[STOPM]=LLSx

peripheralPage.template: \t/* smc_ram2po_mkw41z4.xml */ \t/** \t * Enable the given power modes. \t * A mode must be enabled before it can be entered. \t * \t * @param[in] smcVeryLowPower Allows VLPR, VLPW, and VLPS modes \t * @param[in] smcLowLeakageStop Allows LLSx modes \t * @param[in] smcVeryLowLeakageStop Allows VLLSx modes \t * \t * @note This is a write-once-after-reset operation \t */ \tstatic ErrorCode enablePowerModes( \t SmcVeryLowPower smcVeryLowPower, \t SmcLowLeakageStop smcLowLeakageStop = SmcLowLeakageStop_Disabled, \t SmcVeryLowLeakageStop smcVeryLowLeakageStop = SmcVeryLowLeakageStop_Disabled) { \t \t smc->PMPROT = smcVeryLowPower|smcLowLeakageStop|smcVeryLowLeakageStop; \t return E_NO_ERROR; \t}\n\n

\t/* smc_ram2po_mkw41z4.xml */ \t/** \t * Allows the detailed operation in STOP mode to be controlled. \t * \t * @param[in] smcLowLeakageStopMode Controls which LLS/VLLS sub-mode to enter if STOPM=LLS/VLLS \t * @param[in] smcPowerOnReset Controls whether the POR detect circuit is enabled in VLLS0 mode \t * @param[in] smcPartialStopMode Controls whether a Partial Stop mode is entered when STOPM=STOP \t * @param[in] smcLowLeakageRam2 Control power to RAM partition 2 in LLS2/VLLS2 power mode \t */ \tstatic void setStopOptions( \t SmcLowLeakageStopMode smcLowLeakageStopMode, \t SmcPowerOnReset smcPowerOnReset = SmcPowerOnReset_Disabled, \t SmcPartialStopMode smcPartialStopMode = SmcPartialStopMode_Normal, \t SmcLowLeakageRam2 smcLowLeakageRam2 = SmcLowLeakageRam2_Disabled) { \t \t smc->STOPCTRL = smcPartialStopMode|smcPowerOnReset|smcLowLeakageStopMode|smcLowLeakageRam2; \t}\n\n
